alert.note: Alert for Coastal Cameron; Coastal Willacy; Inland Cameron; Inland Willacy (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 2:58PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Kenedy, northwestern Cameron and central Willacy Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 257 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms centered over Willamar, or 11 miles east of Lyford. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Harlingen, Rio Hondo, Arroyo City, San Perlita, Willamar, Santa Monica, San Perlita High School, Porfirio, Los Coyotes, and Lasana. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
